TopicTitle: What do you play KSP with?

Articles.Content:
I made this thread to find out the ratio of joystick to analog KSP players out there,so vote on!

EDIT:Something happened to the poll,so you guys will have to just type your answer in the replies,sorry
Mouse and keyboard of course
Whoa,I didnt expect to get a reply so quickly
Mouse and Keyboard
Just keyboard on a crapbook air, it sucks.
I use my joystick for planes in the atmosphere, and the keyboard for everything else.
Just started using a joystick.

I play with a potato.

(Mouse and Keyboard, it's just easier)
Mouse and Keyboard for rockets, Joystick for planes.

mouse and keyboard, The superior gaming control devices.

Well ok a joystick would be better for planes... but mouse and keyboard always beats console controllers. Always.

Ze keyboard and ze mouse.

I probably couldn't get used to a joystick.

The keyboard and mouse.

I really wonder if any other device would be better, since the space planes are as controllable as a large truck with lead wheels or spastic cats.
My old Logitech attack 3 is missing buttons and one axis doesn't work, so it mouse and keyboard for me
Mouse and Keyboard but I would like to buy a joystick soon.
Mouse and keyboard on my slowbook air.
Mouse and keyboard. The old joystick I own is a twenty (plus)-year old two-button CH Flightstick, but I don't own a gameport, so it's purely a nostalgia item.

Mouse and Keyboard for rockets, Joystick for planes.

Ditto.

I DO have a gamepad thing that you rest your left had on, and it has buttons for every finger, that I need to find and try using with my joystick, though, too.
Keyboard and joystick on my desktop PC.
I use the tactile pad on a heavily modified speak-and-spell.
Keyboard and mouse, although I'd like to try using a gamepad(my beloved Logitech Rumblepad II) for planes one day.
Mouse and keyboard, I tried using a 360 controller but had problems with it. May get a joystick at some point.
I just got a joystick and I'm getting used to it fast.

Most of the time, I'm a big keyboard person...but I like using my gamepad--a Logitech RumblePad 2--for flying both rockets and planes in KSP. The twin sticks are mapped to the pitch and yaw (left stick) and roll (right stick) axes; the trigger buttons on the left control throttle; the four buttons on top and trigger buttons on the right are for translation; other buttons toggle RCS and SAS and map mode and precision control.

There's of course plenty of things, such as action groups, that the pad doesn't have enough buttons for, and of course it's not of much use in map mode or the VAB, but I do enjoy flying with it.

I do have to use the keyboard for EVAs...in version 0.21.1, jetpacks tend to freak out from time to time, for some reason, if I've mapped any of the EVA controls to the gamepad (even if I'm trying to use the keyboard for control at that moment).
Mouse and keyboard. I've been meaning to pickup a joystick to make flying spaceplanes more natural.
Trackball, keyboard, Logitech 3D Pro, occasional XBox 360 controller, scientific calculator, excel spreadsheet, a notepad and an ink pen.
